meanings.definition: A small amount of work done to improve something, especially in terms of appearance.
meanings.sent1: She did some touchups on her painting to make it look better.
meanings.sent2: The painter always does touchups on his artwork before exhibiting it.
meanings.sent3: After some touchups, the old car looked almost brand new.
meanings.sent4: The touchups on the dress transformed it from plain to elegant.
meanings.sent5: With a few touchups, the room became a cozy space.

meanings.definition: The act of making small adjustments or corrections to something.
meanings.sent1: He made some touchups to the essay to correct the spelling errors.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic performed touchups on the engine to ensure it ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The chef's touchups to the recipe turned it into a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: Her touchups to the design fixed the flaws and made it perfect.
meanings.sent5: The touchups to the plan improved its efficiency.

meanings.definition: The process of adding finishing touches or final details to something.
meanings.sent1: The interior designer did some touchups to the room to complete the look.
meanings.sent2: Before the presentation, she made some touchups to the slides.
meanings.sent3: The touchups to the cake made it a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His touchups to the speech added a touch of humor.
meanings.sent5: The touchups to the garden transformed it into a beautiful oasis.
